briefdescription.para: returns the center of the sphere spanned by the points in A = tuple[first,last).

simplesect.para: $ A$ contains $ d+1$ affinely independent points of dimension $ d$.

briefdescription.para: returns the projection of $ p = (x_0,\ldots,x_{d-1})$ onto the paraboloid of revolution which is the point $ (p_0, \ldots,p_{d-1},\sum_{0 \le i < d}p_i^2)$ in $ (d+1)$-space.
computes a basis of the linear space spanned by the vectors in A = tuple [first,last) and returns it via an iterator range starting in result.

detaileddescription.para:
The returned iterator marks the end of the output.
$ A$ contains vectors of the same dimension $ d$.
ForwardIterator
has Vector_d<R> as value type.

briefdescription.para: computes the midpoint of the segment $ pq$.
returns $ p$ projected along the $ d$-axis onto the hyperspace spanned by the first $ d-1$ standard base vectors.
computes the square of the Euclidean distance between the two points $ p$ and $ q$.

simplesect.para: The dimensions of $ p$ and $ q$ are the same.

briefdescription.para: checks whether obj1 and obj2 intersect.

detaileddescription.para: Two objects obj1 and obj2 intersect if there is a point p that is part of both obj1 and obj2. The intersection region of those two objects is defined as the set of all points p that are part of both obj1 and obj2.

The objects are of the same dimension.
The types Type1 and Type2 can be any of the following:

briefdescription.para: returns the intersection between f1 and f2.

detaileddescription.para:
The objects are of the same dimension.
The same functionality is also available through the functor Kernel::Intersect_d.
The following table gives the possible values for Type1 and Type2.

The return type of intersecting two objects of the types Type1 and Type2 can be specified through the placeholder type specifier auto. It is equivalent to std::optional< std::variant< T... > >, the last column in the table providing the template parameter pack.
The following example demonstrates the most common use of intersection routines.

briefdescription.para: returns true iff the points in A = tuple [first,last) are affinely independent.

simplesect.para: The objects are of the same dimension.

briefdescription.para: computes the affine rank of the points in A = tuple [first,last).

simplesect.para: The objects in $ A$ are of the same dimension.

briefdescription.para: Compares the Cartesian coordinates of points p and q lexicographically in ascending order of its Cartesian components p[i] and q[i] for $ i = 0,\ldots,d-1$.

memberdef.argsstring: (ForwardIterator first, ForwardIterator last, const Point_d< R > &p)
memberdef.name: contained_in_affine_hull

briefdescription.para: determines whether $ p$ is contained in the affine hull of the points in A = tuple [first,last).

simplesect.para: The objects in A are of the same dimension.

memberdef.argsstring: (ForwardIterator first, ForwardIterator last, const Vector_d< R > &v)
memberdef.name: contained_in_linear_hull

briefdescription.para: determines whether $ v$ is contained in the linear hull of the vectors in A = tuple [first,last).

simplesect.para: The objects in $ A$ are of the same dimension.

memberdef.argsstring: (ForwardIterator first, ForwardIterator last, const Point_d< R > &p)
memberdef.name: contained_in_simplex

briefdescription.para: determines whether $ p$ is contained in the simplex of the points in A = tuple [first,last).

simplesect.para: The objects in $ A$ are of the same dimension and affinely independent.

briefdescription.para: returns true iff p is lexicographically smaller than q with respect to Cartesian lexicographic order of points.
returns true iff $ p$ is lexicographically smaller than $ q$ with respect to Cartesian lexicographic order of points or equal to $ q$.
decides whether the vectors in A = tuple [first,last) are linearly independent.

simplesect.para: The objects in A are of the same dimension.

briefdescription.para: computes the linear rank of the vectors in A = tuple [first,last).

simplesect.para: The objects are of the same dimension.

briefdescription.para: determines the orientation of the points of the tuple A = tuple [first,last) where $ A$ consists of $ d+1$ points in $ d$-space.

detaileddescription.para:
This is the sign of the determinant \[ \left| \begin{array}{cccc} 1 & 1 & 1 & 1 \\ A[0] & A[1] & \dots& A[d] \end{array} \right| \] where A[i] denotes the Cartesian coordinate vector of the $ i$-th point in $ A$.
size [first,last) == d+1 and A[i].dimension() == d $ \forall0 \leq i \leq d$.
ForwardIterator
has Point_d<R> as value type.

memberdef.argsstring: (ForwardIterator first, ForwardIterator last, const Point_d< R > &p)
memberdef.name: side_of_bounded_sphere

briefdescription.para: returns the relative position of point p to the sphere defined by A = tuple [first,last).

detaileddescription.para: The order of the points of $ A$ does not matter.

memberdef.argsstring: (ForwardIterator first, ForwardIterator last, const Point_d< R > &p)
memberdef.name: side_of_oriented_sphere

briefdescription.para: returns the relative position of point p to the oriented sphere defined by the points in A = tuple [first,last) The order of the points in $ A$ is important, since it determines the orientation of the implicitly constructed sphere.

detaileddescription.para: If the points in $ A$ are positively oriented, the positive side is the bounded interior of the sphere.

simplesect.para: A contains $ d+1$ points in $ d$-space.
